concise_definition: adj. 子宫颈的, 颈部的

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to the cervix, which is the lower, narrow end of the uterus that connects to the vagina; commonly used in medical contexts to describe conditions, tests, or structures associated with this part of the female reproductive system.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指与子宫颈（子宫下端连接阴道的部分）相关的，常用于医学语境中描述与女性生殖系统这一部位相关的疾病、检查或结构。
definitions.example_en: She received a cervical smear test to screen for early signs of cancer.
definitions.example_cn: 她接受了宫颈涂片检查，以筛查早期癌症迹象。

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to the neck, especially the cervical vertebrae or cervical region in the human body; often used in anatomy and orthopedics to describe structures in the upper spine.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指与颈部相关的，尤指人体的颈椎或颈段区域；常用于解剖学和骨科中描述上脊柱的结构。
definitions.example_en: The patient complained of chronic pain in the cervical spine after the car accident.
definitions.example_cn: 车祸后，患者主诉颈椎部位长期疼痛。

comparison.analysis: “Neck” (颈部) 是一个通用名词，泛指身体连接头部与躯干的部分，可指解剖结构，也可用于比喻（如“脖子”）。而 “cervical” 是专业术语，仅用于医学或解剖学语境，特指与颈椎或子宫颈相关的，语义更精确、更局限。
“Uterine” (子宫的) 指与子宫主体相关的，而 “cervical” 仅指子宫的下端开口部分——子宫颈。两者属于同一系统但解剖位置不同：子宫体是主要腔室，子宫颈是通道。例如，子宫肌瘤是 uterine，而宫颈糜烂是 cervical。
“Vertebral” (脊椎的) 指整个脊柱（颈椎、胸椎、腰椎等）的任何部分，范围更广。而 “cervical” 仅特指脊柱最上端的七块颈椎（C1–C7）。因此，cervical 是 vertebral 的一个子集，语义更具体。
